description: Cluster designed for tagging OSINT artifacts that relate to the taxonomy language found in either the HITRUST Threat Catalogue or the ENISA Threat Taxonomy.
name: OSRS Operational Framewrok - Human Threat
source: HITRUST Threat Catalogue and the ENISA Threat Taxonomy

values.description: Deliberate actions aimed to cause disruption or damage to information and/or IT assets for financial or personal gain.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIC1 Sabotage

values.description: The use of violence as a means to create terror among masses of people; or fear to achieve a financial, political, religious or ideological aim.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIC2 Terrorism

values.description: Deliberate destruction or damage to information and (or) IT assets but, not for personal gain.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIC3 Vandalism

values.description: To appropriate something, such as property entrusted to one's care fraudulently to one's own use. A form of theft through fraud.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIM1 Embezzlement

values.description: The act of obtaining money, property, or services from an organization through coercion.  A form of theft through use of force or intimidation to obtain compliance.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIM2 Extortion

values.description: Deliberate deception to secure unfair or unlawful gain, or to deprive a victim of a legal right.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIM3 Fraud

values.description: The act of logically stealing and (or) removing of the property with intent to deprive the rightful owner of it.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIM4 Theft

values.description: Threat of unintentional but damaging distribution of information due to human error.  May include accidental leaks by employees, leaks via mobile applications, leaks via web applications, or leaks of information transfered over network mediums.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: ENISA Information Leakage OR Sharing Due to Human Error
